title: Catching up with Tesla: How Elon Musk is battling to stay ahead of the car giants
text:
When Tesla launched the Roadster in 2008, buyers of the first $109,000 (£85,000) car included George Clooney, former eBay president Jeff Skoll and billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk himself, then chairman of the company.

Now its chief executive, Musk is following a long-held plan to put Teslas in the driveways of the middle classes, pushing down the price of its most affordable Model 3 to $36,200 in the US. It still makes the premium models, costing upwards of $75,000, but they are a bit-part in its plans for the future. “We’re continuing to make them more for sentimental reasons than anything else,” he told analysts on the company’s third-quarter results call last week.

There’s no doubt that...
description: When Tesla launched the Roadster in 2008, buyers  of the first $109,000 (£85,000) car included George Clooney, former eBay president  Jeff Skoll and billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk himself, then chairman of the company.
